findings.title: Use of non-compliant tokens with Balancer may cause integration failure
findings.description: The Quads codebase integrates into Balancer proxies that contain assumptions about how tokens work. Non-ERC20 compliant tokens may cause integration failure.

findings.title: Token scarcity issues must be executed manually
findings.description: Reviews of token scarcity issues must be executed manually. Check for the following conditions: supply is owned by more than a few users, total supply is sufficient, tokens are located in more than a few exchanges, users understand risks associated with large amount of funds or flash loans, and the token does not allow flash minting.

findings.title: The supply is owned by more than a few users
findings.description: If a few users own most of the tokens, they can influence operations based on the tokens' repartition.

findings.title: The total supply is sufficient
findings.description: Tokens with a low total supply can be easily manipulated.

findings.title: The tokens are located in more than a few exchanges
findings.description: Tokens concentrated in one exchange can compromise the contract relying on the token if the exchange is compromised.

findings.title: Users understand the risks associated with a large amount of funds or flash loans
findings.description: Users should carefully check the vault calls and all arguments to reduce risks associated with privileged users and ensure correct fund transfer and withdrawal.

findings.title: The token does not allow flash minting
findings.description: Flash minting can lead to substantial swings in the balance and the total supply, which necessitate strict and comprehensive overflow checks in the operation of the token.
